title: An Overview of readODS
text: can append another sheet existing ods file sheet name “mtcars_ods”. Read specific sheet. Notice row names missing. can also integer sheet, e.g. 2 second sheet. Update existing sheet preserve row names Notice information sheet mtcars_ods updated. Read specific range append existing sheet. update missing sheet.

title: An Overview of readODS
text: much faster write data frames file putting (named) list.
code: write_ods(list("iris" = iris, "plant" = PlantGrowth), "plant_multi.ods") read_ods("plant_multi.ods", sheet = "plant") #> # A tibble: 30 × 2 #>    weight group #>     <dbl> <chr> #>  1   4.17 ctrl  #>  2   5.58 ctrl  #>  3   5.18 ctrl  #>  4   6.11 ctrl  #>  5   4.5  ctrl  #>  6   4.61 ctrl  #>  7   5.17 ctrl  #>  8   4.53 ctrl  #>  9   5.33 ctrl  #> 10   5.14 ctrl  #> # ℹ 20 more rows

title: An Overview of readODS
text: Can read read_ods() 2 (note function used read flat files, matter extension). behaviour arguments read_ods() write_ods() can used write Flat ODS files
code: read_fods("plant.fods") write_ods(PlantGrowth, "plant.fods")

title: An Overview of readODS
text: Use function list_ods_sheets() list sheets (F)ODS file.
code: list_ods_sheets("plant.ods") #> [1] "Sheet1"     "mtcars_ods"

title: An Overview of readODS
text: Starting 2.0.0, write_ods writes NA empty default. want NA written literally string “NA”, use na_as_string. literally see string “NA” file opened LibreOffice, example. string “NA” messes automatic type inference read_ods. course can fix specifying col_types. Several functions removed readODS 2.0.0. Please consider API readODS mature breaking change readODS 3.0.0.
code: PlantGrowth2 <- tibble::as_tibble(PlantGrowth) PlantGrowth2[1,1] <- NA PlantGrowth2$group <- as.character(PlantGrowth2$group)  ## NA is preseved; weight is still <dbl> read_ods(write_ods(PlantGrowth2)) #> # A tibble: 30 × 2 #>    weight group #>     <dbl> <chr> #>  1  NA    ctrl  #>  2   5.58 ctrl  #>  3   5.18 ctrl  #>  4   6.11 ctrl  #>  5   4.5  ctrl  #>  6   4.61 ctrl  #>  7   5.17 ctrl  #>  8   4.53 ctrl  #>  9   5.33 ctrl  #> 10   5.14 ctrl  #> # ℹ 20 more rows ## NA is preseved; but weight is now <chr> read_ods(write_ods(PlantGrowth2, na_as_string = TRUE)) #> # A tibble: 30 × 2 #>    weight group #>    <chr>  <chr> #>  1 NA     ctrl  #>  2 5.58   ctrl  #>  3 5.18   ctrl  #>  4 6.11   ctrl  #>  5 4.5    ctrl  #>  6 4.61   ctrl  #>  7 5.17   ctrl  #>  8 4.53   ctrl  #>  9 5.33   ctrl  #> 10 5.14   ctrl  #> # ℹ 20 more rows ## NA is preseved; but weight is now <chr> read_ods(write_ods(PlantGrowth2, na_as_string = TRUE),          col_types = readr::cols(weight = readr::col_double())) #> Warning: [0, 1]: expected a double, but got 'NA' #> # A tibble: 30 × 2 #>    weight group #>     <dbl> <chr> #>  1  NA    ctrl  #>  2   5.58 ctrl  #>  3   5.18 ctrl  #>  4   6.11 ctrl  #>  5   4.5  ctrl  #>  6   4.61 ctrl  #>  7   5.17 ctrl  #>  8   4.53 ctrl  #>  9   5.33 ctrl  #> 10   5.14 ctrl  #> # ℹ 20 more rows

title: An Overview of readODS
text: Please use list_ods_sheets(path = "plant.ods") instead.
code: ## ods_sheets("plant.ods") list_ods_sheets("plant.ods") #> [1] "Sheet1"     "mtcars_ods"

title: An Overview of readODS
text: Please use list_ods_sheets
code: ##get_num_sheets_in_ods("plant.ods") length(list_ods_sheets("plant.ods")) #> [1] 2

title: An Overview of readODS
text: Please use read_ods. order emulate behaviours read.ods, followings recommended

code: @Manual{,   title = {readODS: Read and Write ODS Files},   author = {Gerrit-Jan Schutten and Chung-hong Chan and Peter Brohan and Detlef Steuer and Thomas J. Leeper},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2.2.0, https://github.com/ropensci/readODS},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/readODS/}, }

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: goal readODS enable R read write OpenDocument Spreadsheet (ODS) files. package supports ordinary ODS “Flat ODS” (fods).

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: Install latest stable version CRAN: R-universe: install development version Github:
code: install.packages("readODS") install.packages("readODS", repos = "https://ropensci.r-universe.dev") remotes::install_github("ropensci/readODS")

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: almost use cases, need two functions: read_ods write_ods. Simple.

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: Reading 2nd sheet Reading specific range Reading dataframe
code: library(readODS) read_ods("starwars.ods") #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    Name               homeworld species #>    <chr>              <chr>     <chr>   #>  1 Luke Skywalker     Tatooine  Human   #>  2 C-3PO              Tatooine  Human   #>  3 R2-D2              Alderaan  Human   #>  4 Darth Vader        Tatooine  Human   #>  5 Leia Organa        Tatooine  Human   #>  6 Owen Lars          Tatooine  Human   #>  7 Beru Whitesun lars Stewjon   Human   #>  8 R5-D4              Tatooine  Human   #>  9 Biggs Darklighter  Kashyyyk  Wookiee #> 10 Obi-Wan Kenobi     Corellia  Human read_ods("starwars.ods", sheet = 2) #> # A tibble: 10 × 8 #>    Name           height  mass hair_color skin_color eye_color birth_year gender #>    <chr>           <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <chr>      <chr>          <dbl> <chr>  #>  1 Luke Skywalker    172    77 blond      fair       blue            19   male   #>  2 C-3PO             202   136 none       white      yellow          41.9 male   #>  3 R2-D2             150    49 brown      light      brown           19   female #>  4 Darth Vader       178   120 brown, gr… light      blue            52   male   #>  5 Leia Organa       165    75 brown      light      blue            47   female #>  6 Owen Lars         183    84 black      light      brown           24   male   #>  7 Beru Whitesun…    182    77 auburn, w… fair       blue-gray       57   male   #>  8 R5-D4             188    84 blond      fair       blue            41.9 male   #>  9 Biggs Darklig…    228   112 brown      unknown    blue           200   male   #> 10 Obi-Wan Kenobi    180    80 brown      fair       brown           29   male read_ods("starwars.ods", sheet = 2, range = "A1:C11") #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    Name               height  mass #>    <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Luke Skywalker        172    77 #>  2 C-3PO                 202   136 #>  3 R2-D2                 150    49 #>  4 Darth Vader           178   120 #>  5 Leia Organa           165    75 #>  6 Owen Lars             183    84 #>  7 Beru Whitesun lars    182    77 #>  8 R5-D4                 188    84 #>  9 Biggs Darklighter     228   112 #> 10 Obi-Wan Kenobi        180    80 read_ods("starwars.ods", range="Sheet1!A2:C11", as_tibble = FALSE) #>       Luke.Skywalker Tatooine   Human #> 1              C-3PO Tatooine   Human #> 2              R2-D2 Alderaan   Human #> 3        Darth Vader Tatooine   Human #> 4        Leia Organa Tatooine   Human #> 5          Owen Lars Tatooine   Human #> 6 Beru Whitesun lars  Stewjon   Human #> 7              R5-D4 Tatooine   Human #> 8  Biggs Darklighter Kashyyyk Wookiee #> 9     Obi-Wan Kenobi Corellia   Human

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: Appending sheet
code: ## preserve the row names write_ods(mtcars, "mtcars.ods", row_names = TRUE) write_ods(PlantGrowth, "mtcars.ods", append = TRUE, sheet = "plant") ## Default: First sheet read_ods("mtcars.ods") #> New names: #> • `` -> `...1` #> # A tibble: 32 × 12 #>    ...1          mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb #>    <chr>       <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Mazda RX4    21       6  160    110  3.9   2.62  16.5     0     1     4     4 #>  2 Mazda RX4 …  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.88  17.0     0     1     4     4 #>  3 Datsun 710   22.8     4  108     93  3.85  2.32  18.6     1     1     4     1 #>  4 Hornet 4 D…  21.4     6  258    110  3.08  3.22  19.4     1     0     3     1 #>  5 Hornet Spo…  18.7     8  360    175  3.15  3.44  17.0     0     0     3     2 #>  6 Valiant      18.1     6  225    105  2.76  3.46  20.2     1     0     3     1 #>  7 Duster 360   14.3     8  360    245  3.21  3.57  15.8     0     0     3     4 #>  8 Merc 240D    24.4     4  147.    62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2 #>  9 Merc 230     22.8     4  141.    95  3.92  3.15  22.9     1     0     4     2 #> 10 Merc 280     19.2     6  168.   123  3.92  3.44  18.3     1     0     4     4 #> # ℹ 22 more rows read_ods("mtcars.ods", sheet = "plant", range = "A1:B10") #> # A tibble: 9 × 2 #>   weight group #>    <dbl> <chr> #> 1   4.17 ctrl  #> 2   5.58 ctrl  #> 3   5.18 ctrl  #> 4   6.11 ctrl  #> 5   4.5  ctrl  #> 6   4.61 ctrl  #> 7   5.17 ctrl  #> 8   4.53 ctrl  #> 9   5.33 ctrl

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: Reading maximum size sheet can read determined machine’s RAM. Writing can theoretically write sheets 16 384 columns 1 048 576 rows (current maximum sheet size Excel LibreOffice Calc). larger ODS files valid, well supported. However older version LibreOffice (<=7.3) Excel (<=2003) significantly smaller maximum sheet sizes, considered writing files distribution.

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: logo readODS remix LibreOffice Calc v6.1 icon created Document Foundation. original LibreOffice logo licensed Creative Commons Attribution Share-Alike 3.0 Unported License. readODS product Document Foundation. logo readODS licensed Creative Commons Attribution Share-Alike 3.0 Unported License. creator package Gerrit-Jan Schutten. current maintainer Chung-hong Chan. package benefits contributions Peter Brohan, Thomas J. Leeper, John Foster, Sergio Oller, Jim Hester, Stephen Watts, Arthur Katossky, Stas Malavin, Duncan Garmonsway, Mehrad Mahmoudian, Matt Kerlogue, Detlef Steuer, Michal Lauer, Till Straube. package emulates behaviours readxl::read_xlsx, writexl::write_xlsx xlsx::write.xlsx. package silent member rio, don’t need care file format .

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: GPL3

title: Read and Write ODS Files
text: Contributions form feedback, comments, code, bug report welcome. Fork source code, modify, issue pull request. Issues, bug reports: File Github issue. Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Get information in an (F)ODS File — list_ods_sheets
title: Get information in an (F)ODS File — list_ods_sheets
text: list_ods_sheets lists sheets (f)ods file. function can used listing sheets ods flat ods files. (list_fods_sheets) also available, can list sheets flat ods files.

title: Get information in an (F)ODS File — list_ods_sheets
code: list_ods_sheets(   path,   include_external_data = FALSE,   ods_format = c("auto", "ods", "fods"),   guess = FALSE )  list_fods_sheets(path, include_external_data = FALSE)  ods_sheets(path)

title: Get information in an (F)ODS File — list_ods_sheets
text: path Path (f)ods file include_external_data boolean value show hide sheets containing archived linked data (default false) ods_format character, must "auto", "ods" "fods". default "auto" determine format automatically. default, format determined file extension, unless guess FALSE. guess logical, file extension absent recognized, controls whether attempt guess format based file signature "magic number".

title: Get information in an (F)ODS File — list_ods_sheets
text: character vector sheet names

title: Get information in an (F)ODS File — list_ods_sheets
text: default "include_external_data" ods_sheets TRUE maintain compatibility version 1 readODS. change TRUE version 3.

title: Get information in an (F)ODS File — list_ods_sheets
text: Peter Brohan peter.brohan+cran@gmail.com, Chung-hong Chan chainsawtiney@gmail.com, Gerrit-Jan Schutten phonixor@gmail.com

title: Get information in an (F)ODS File — list_ods_sheets
code: if (FALSE) { # Get the list of names of sheets list_ods_sheets("starwars.ods") list_ods_sheets("starwars.fods") # Using list_fods_sheets, although you don't have to list_fods_sheets("starwars.fods") }

what: readODS: Read and Write ODS Files — readODS-package
title: readODS: Read and Write ODS Files — readODS-package
text: Read ODS (OpenDocument Spreadsheet) R data frame. Also support writing data frame ODS file.

title: readODS: Read and Write ODS Files — readODS-package
text: Maintainer: Chung-hong Chan chainsawtiney@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Gerrit-Jan Schutten phonixor@gmail.com Peter Brohan peter.brohan@gmail.com Detlef Steuer steuer@hsu-hh.de (ORCID) Thomas J. Leeper thosjleeper@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: John Foster john.x.foster@nab.com.au [contributor] Sergio Oller [contributor] Jim Hester jim.hester@rstudio.com (ORCID) [contributor] Stephen Watts [contributor] Arthur Katossky [contributor] Stas Malavin [contributor] Duncan Garmonsway [contributor] Mehrad Mahmoudian [contributor] Matt Kerlogue [contributor] Michal Lauer michal.lauer.25@gmail.com [contributor] Till Straube straube@geo.uni-frankfurt.de [contributor] Marcin Kalicinski (Author included RapidXML code) [contributor, copyright holder]

title: Read Data From (F)ODS File — read_ods
text: read_ods function read single sheet (f)ods file return data frame. function can used reading ods flat ods files. (read_fods) also available, can read flat ods files.

title: Read Data From (F)ODS File — read_ods
code: read_ods(   path,   sheet = 1,   col_names = TRUE,   col_types = NULL,   na = "",   skip = 0,   formula_as_formula = FALSE,   range = NULL,   row_names = FALSE,   strings_as_factors = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   as_tibble = TRUE,   .name_repair = "unique",   ods_format = c("auto", "ods", "fods"),   guess = FALSE,   trim_ws = TRUE,   n_max = Inf )  read_fods(   path,   sheet = 1,   col_names = TRUE,   col_types = NULL,   na = "",   skip = 0,   formula_as_formula = FALSE,   range = NULL,   row_names = FALSE,   strings_as_factors = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   as_tibble = TRUE,   .name_repair = "unique",   trim_ws = TRUE,   n_max = Inf )

title: Read Data From (F)ODS File — read_ods
text: path path (f)ods file. sheet sheet read. Either string (sheet name), integer sheet number. default 1. col_names logical, indicating whether file contains names variables first line. Default TRUE. col_types Either NULL guess spreadsheet refer readr::type_convert() specify cols specification. can also shorthand "ccf" ("character", "character", "factor"), list, object created readr::cols(). NA return data frame columns "characters". Please note speed reading lot specifying parameter explicitly. accuracy. na Character vector strings use missing values. default read_ods converts blank cells missing data. can also set NULL, empty cells treated NA. skip number lines data file skip beginning read data. parameter larger total number lines ods file, empty data frame returned. formula_as_formula logical, switch display formulas formulas "SUM(A1:A3)" resulting value "3"... "8".. . Default FALSE. range selection rectangle using Excel-like cell range, range = "D12:F15" range = "R1C12:R6C15". Cell range processing handled cellranger package. sheet name range, range = "Sheet2!A2:B7", sheet name used instead provided sheet. sheet default value (1), warning given. row_names logical, indicating whether file contains names rows first column. Default FALSE. strings_as_factors logical, character columns converted factors. Default FALSE. verbose logical, messages displayed. Default FALSE. as_tibble logical, output tibble (opposed data.frame). Default TRUE. .name_repair string function passed .name_repair tibble::as_tibble() "minimal": name repair "unique" : Make sure names unique empty "check_unique": Check names unique, repair "universal" : Checks names unique valid R variables names scope function apply custom name repair. Default "unique". ods_format character, must "auto", "ods" "fods". default "auto" determine format automatically. default, format determined file extension, unless guess FALSE. guess logical, file extension absent recognized, controls whether attempt guess format based file signature "magic number". trim_ws logical, leading trailing whitespace trimmed? n_max numeric, Maximum number data rows read. Ignored range given.

title: Read Data From (F)ODS File — read_ods
text: tibble (tibble) data frame (data.frame) containing representation data (f)ods file.

title: Read Data From (F)ODS File — read_ods
text: Peter Brohan peter.brohan+cran@gmail.com, Chung-hong Chan chainsawtiney@gmail.com, Gerrit-Jan Schutten phonixor@gmail.com

title: Read Data From (F)ODS File — read_ods
code: if (FALSE) { # Read an ODS file read_ods("starwars.ods") # Read a specific sheet, e.g. the 2nd sheet read_ods("starwars.ods", sheet = 2) # Read a specific range, e.g. A1:C11 read_ods("starwars.ods", sheet = 2, range = "A1:C11") # Read an FODS file read_ods("starwars.fods") # Read a specific sheet, e.g. the 2nd sheet read_ods("starwars.fods", sheet = 2) # Read a specific range, e.g. A1:C11 read_ods("starwars.fods", sheet = 2, range = "A1:C11") # Give a warning and read from Sheet1 (not 2) read_ods("starwars.fods", sheet = 2, range = "Sheet1!A1:C11") # Specifying col_types as shorthand, the third column as factor; other by guessing read_ods("starwars.ods", col_types = "??f") # Specifying col_types as list read_ods("starwars.ods", col_types = list(species = "f")) # Using read_fods, although you don't have to read_ods("starwars.fods") }

title: Write Data to (F)ODS File — write_ods
text: Function write single data frame list data frames (f)ods file.

title: Write Data to (F)ODS File — write_ods
code: write_ods(   x,   path = tempfile(fileext = ".ods"),   sheet = "Sheet1",   append = FALSE,   update = FALSE,   row_names = FALSE,   col_names = TRUE,   na_as_string = FALSE,   padding = FALSE )  write_fods(   x,   path = tempfile(fileext = ".fods"),   sheet = "Sheet1",   append = FALSE,   update = FALSE,   row_names = FALSE,   col_names = TRUE,   na_as_string = FALSE,   padding = FALSE )

title: Write Data to (F)ODS File — write_ods
text: x data frame list data frames sheets (f)ods. list named, names used sheet names path Path (f)ods file write sheet Name sheet; ignore x list data frames append logical, TRUE indicates x appended existing file (path) new sheet. sheet sheet_name exists, exception thrown. See update. Please also note writing slightly slower TRUE. Default FALSE. Ignore x list data frames update logical, TRUE indicates sheet sheet_name existing file (path) updated content x. sheet sheet_name exist, exception thrown. Please also note writing slightly slower TRUE. Default FALSE. Ignore x list data frames row_names logical, TRUE indicates row names x included sheet. Default FALSE col_names logical, TRUE indicates column names x included sheet. Default TRUE na_as_string logical, TRUE indicates NAs written string; FALSE indicates NAs written empty cells padding logical, TRUE indicates sheet padded repeated empty cells maximum size, either 2^20 x 1024 (number columns x less equal 1024) 2^20 x 16,384 (otherwise). default behaviour Microsoft Excel. Default FALSE

title: Write Data to (F)ODS File — write_ods
text: (F)ODS file written file path location specified user. value path also returned invisibly

title: Write Data to (F)ODS File — write_ods
text: function emulates writexl::write_xlsx() openxlsx::write.xlsx() except handling list columns. expected behaviour undefined two functions behave differently. function handles list columns converting character vectors R code (similar output dput()), probably ideal.

title: Write Data to (F)ODS File — write_ods
text: Detlef Steuer steuer@hsu-hh.de, Thomas J. Leeper thosjleeper@gmail.com, John Foster john.x.foster@nab.com.au, Chung-hong Chan chainsawtiney@gmail.com

title: Write Data to (F)ODS File — write_ods
code: if (FALSE) { # preserve the row names write_ods(mtcars, "mtcars.ods", row_names = TRUE) # append a sheet to an existing file write_ods(PlantGrowth, "mtcars.ods", append = TRUE, sheet = "plant") # This is however faster write_ods(list("Sheet1" = mtcars, "plant" = PlantGrowth), "mtcars.ods", row_names = TRUE) # write flat ODS file write_fods(mtcars, "mtcars.fods", sheet = "mtcars") }

title: readODS 2.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-01 Fix #151 - Now read_ods() list_ods_sheets() can also used process flat ods files. read_fods() list_fods_sheets() still available, -called “common interface.” Fix #154 - read_ods() read_fods() two arguments - trim_ws n_max arguments readxl::read_excel().

title: readODS 2.1.1
text: Fix #170 - .name_repair correctly passed. Fix #180 - specify minimum cpp11 version

title: readODS 2.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-10

what: append and update of write_ods in C++
title: readODS 2.0.7
text: Significant speed improvement; also xml2 longer dependency.

what: POTENTIALLY BREAKING: reading single-row / single-column (F)ODS and col_names / row_names
title: readODS 2.0.7
text: Prior previous stable release, <= 1.9.0, reading single-row / single-column col_names = TRUE / row_names = TRUE produced errors. v1.9.0 (stable version v2.0.0 CRAN), reading single-row / single-column (F)ODS col_names = TRUE / row_names = TRUE override two parameters return non-empty data frame. behaviour consistent data reading R functions (see #146) readxl::read_xlsx(), readr::read_csv(), data.table::fread(), openxlsx::read.xlsx(). functions, either empty zero-row data.frame returned. changed behaviour. following return zero-row data.frame default. However, previous behaviour stable release backward compatibility needed. need previous behaviour, please set options("readODS.v200" = TRUE)
code: read_ods(write_ods(mtcars[0,])) ## col_names is TRUE by default options("readODS.v200" = TRUE) read_ods(write_ods(mtcars[0,])) ## col_names is TRUE by default

what: write_ods and write_fods allow list of data frames
title: readODS 2.06
text: Fix #56; now writexl::write_xlsx().
code: write_ods(list("some_car_data" = mtcars, "some_flower_data" = iris))

title: readODS 2.06
text: Fix #157 list_fods_sheets() read_fods() accept ~ path Fix #163 list_fods_sheets() can’t guard non-fods XML disguised fods

what: Reverse the decision to deprecate ods_sheets
title: readODS 2.05
text: See discussion #133

what: col_types can be character (“shorthand”) or list
title: readODS 2.04
text: fix #135 review Dr Ruedni
code: # Specifying col_types as shorthand, the third column as factor; other by guessing read_ods("starwars.ods", col_types = "??f") # Specifying col_types as list read_ods("starwars.ods", col_types = list(species = "f"))

what: Add support for writing flat ODS
title: readODS 2.0.3
text: write_fods available, fix #103

title: readODS 2.0.2
text: write_ods partially rewritten C++ #140

title: readODS 2.0.2
text: ensure UTF-8 everywhere, fix #107 Bump requirement R>=3.6

title: readODS 2.0.2
text: write empty sheet #142

what: Fix writing data time columns error #137
title: readODS 2.0.1
text: dttm column incorrectly written one column. ’s now fixed.

title: readODS 2.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-10

title: readODS 2.0.0
text: default na_as_string getOption("write_ods_na", default = FALSE) v1.8. default now FALSE, writes NA blank cell (instead buggy behaviour writing NA original type, rendered 0 LibreOffice numeric types. see #79). behaviour compatible default writexl::write_xlsx. behaviour na_as_string = TRUE v1.8: writes NA string.

title: readODS 2.0.0
text: descendant getNrOfSheetsInODS() useful. really need similar function:
code: length(list_ods_sheets("starwars.ods"))

what: BREAKING CHANGES: Removed several obsolete parameters of write_ods()
title: readODS 2.0.0
text: overwrite: always TRUE verbose: always FALSE

what: BREAKING CHANGES: Limited size of sheets writable with write_ods()
title: readODS 2.0.0
text: now refuse write sheets size greater 16384 x 1048576 (max sheet dimensions Excel LibreOffice Calc)

what: BREAKING CHANGES: read_ods now outputs as tibble by default
title: readODS 2.0.0
text: Added as_tibble .name_repair arguments. as_tibble true, outputs tibble using tibble::as_tibble() passing .name_repair (default "unique"). default as_tibble set TRUE. Removed check_names argument. name repairs now dealt using vctrs::vec_as_names(). significantly change default names given outputs. (Names style check_names = TRUE can obtained setting .name_repair = minimal, although advised)

what: Defer the removal of ods_sheets to v3
title: readODS 2.0.0
text: many reverse dependencies using ods_sheets.

title: readODS 1.9.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Rewrote reading functions C++ significant speed increase

what: BREAKING CHANGES: Removed read.ods and ods_sheets
title: readODS 1.9.0
text: deprecated several years.

title: readODS 1.9.0
text: Added include_external_data argument (FALSE default). hides stored data external sources normally accessible user.

title: readODS 1.9.0
text: Changed behaviour one row read. row now correctly appears top row dataframe, warning given column headers requested cause output empty (Note: case column names assigned) Changed behaviour one column read. Previously gave error. row names requested, gives warning cause output empty, assign names. Sheets now accepted part range argument, e.g. Range = "Sheet2!A2:B7". sheets argument given, preferred. Merged cells now value places top-left cell. cells covered merge filled NA. Added as_tibble .name_repair arguments. as_tibble true, outputs tibble using tibble::as_tibble() passing .name_repair (default "check_unique").

title: readODS 1.9.0
text: Reading (writing) flat ODS files now supported using functions read_fods(), list_fods_sheets(), get_num_sheets_in_fods(). work way analogue ODS functions. extension need fods, however need conform OO specification.

title: readODS 1.9.0
text: Attempted fix writing non UTF-8 strings files. still issues versions R < 4.2, however now correctly write text within current locale. See readme details.
